etymology.description: 针(針) (zhēn, "needle") and 灸(灸) (jiǔ, "moxibustion") combine to form the word 针灸(針灸) (zhēnjiǔ, "acupuncture"), which is a traditional Chinese medical practice that involves inserting needles into specific points on the body and sometimes applying heat using moxa (burning mugwort) to those points.
etymology.interpretation: 针灸(針灸) (zhēnjiǔ, "acupuncture") combines the concepts of using needles and heat therapy to promote healing, following principles from traditional Chinese medicine on body energy pathways (meridians).

examples.chinese: 我学过针灸(我學過針灸)。
她认为针灸有效(她認為針灸有效)，能缓解慢性疼痛(能緩解慢性疼痛)。
examples.pinyin: Tā rènwéi zhēnjiǔ yǒuxiào, néng huǎnjiě mànxìng téngtòng.
examples.english: She believes that acupuncture is effective and can alleviate chronic pain.

examples.chinese: 古代医书中记载了针灸的疗效(古代醫書中記載了針灸的療效)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài yīshū zhōng jìzǎi le zhēnjiǔ de liáoxiào.
examples.english: Ancient medical texts recorded the efficacy of acupuncture.
